examples: ... when he should take the sield, that city was persuaded to complete the  regiment they had begun to form, under the command of a Colonel whom the  King had recommended to them ; which they did raise to the number of a  thousand men.

entries.meaning: (obsolete or nonstandard) simple past tense of begin [17th–20th c.]
examples: When we've been there ten thousand years,
We've no less days to sing God's praise,
